subject: Olympic Games
Steroids
lead_paragraph: Dick Pound, the chairman of the World Anti-Doping Agency, told the International Olympic Committee assembly that “more than a handful” of Olympic sports had failed to comply with antidoping rules, endangering their place in future Games. Pound later declined to say which sports or exactly how many were in danger. But a WADA report distributed at the meeting showed that 13 of the 35 Olympic sports federations were not in compliance as of May 4. It also indicated that only 21 of the world’s 203 national Olympic committees had complied.
